purpose: Provides a standardized and safe way to make Git commits to any repository. It ensures that git user.name and user.email are correctly set for the agent and that a secret scan is performed before committing. This module is to be used for all commits made by AI agents.

inputs.commit_message: string (The commit message for the git commit.)

outputs.status: string (Either 'Commit successful!' or an error message.)

path_to_scripting: This module is a self-contained Python script. It would be invoked by an orchestrator or the agent's core logic whenever a Git commit needs to be performed. The `commit_message` input would be passed as an argument to the script. The script would handle all the necessary Git operations, including setting user name/email and performing a secret scan, and return a status.
